title: Make collection creation logging less verbose
description:
Here's roughly what get's logged :


INFO  - 2017-11-27 21:55:09.685; [   ] org.apache.solr.handler.admin.CollectionsHandler; Invoked Collection Action :create with params replicationFactor=1&maxShardsPerNode=-1&collection.configName=test&name=test&action=CREATE&numShards=1&wt=json and sendToOCPQueue=true

comments.content:
Given we see this entry:

INFO  - 2017-11-27 21:55:14.095; [   ] org.apache.solr.servlet.HttpSolrCall; [admin] webapp=null path=/admin/collections params={replicationFactor=1&maxShardsPerNode=-1&collection.configName=test&name=test&action=CREATE&numShards=1&wt=json} status=0 QTime=4410



We can change the following to DEBUG:


INFO  - 2017-11-27 21:55:09.685; [   ] org.apache.solr.handler.admin.CollectionsHandler; Invoked Collection Action :create with params replicationFactor=1&maxShardsPerNode=-1&collection.configName=test&name=test&action=CREATE&numShards=1&wt=json and sendToOCPQueue=true
INFO  - 2017-11-27 21:55:09.719; [   ] org.apache.solr.cloud.CreateCollectionCmd; Create collection test
INFO  - 2017-11-27 21:55:09.928; [   ] org.apache.solr.cloud.overseer.SliceMutator; createReplica() {
  "operation":"ADDREPLICA",
  "collection":"test",
  "shard":"shard1",
  "core":"test_shard1_replica_n1",
  "state":"down",
  "base_url":"http://172.16.0.83:8983/solr",
  "type":"NRT"}
comments.author: Varun Thacker

comments.content:
Should MDC be putting the core name in places like this?


INFO  - 2017-11-27 21:55:12.649; [   ] org.apache.solr.update.CommitTracker; Hard AutoCommit: if uncommited for 15000ms; 
INFO  - 2017-11-27 21:55:12.649; [   ] org.apache.solr.update.CommitTracker; Soft AutoCommit: disabled



This line seems completely unnecessary 

INFO  - 2017-11-27 21:55:12.230; [   ] org.apache.solr.core.SolrCore; solr.RecoveryStrategy.Builder



Move to DEBUG

INFO  - 2017-11-27 21:55:12.338; [   ] org.apache.solr.response.XSLTResponseWriter; xsltCacheLifetimeSeconds=5




INFO  - 2017-11-27 21:55:12.789; [   ] org.apache.solr.core.QuerySenderListener; QuerySenderListener sending requests to Searcher@70fa64c2[test_shard1_replica_n1] main{ExitableDirectoryReader(UninvertingDirectoryReader())}
INFO  - 2017-11-27 21:55:12.789; [   ] org.apache.solr.core.QuerySenderListener; QuerySenderListener done.



Show these only if there are warm queries
comments.author: Varun Thacker

comments.content: I'd like some thoughts from Noble Paul / Shalin Shekhar Mangar / Cao Manh Dat on which lines from SolrConfigHandler and ZkStateReader$StateWatcher are important .
comments.author: Varun Thacker

comments.content:
The main motivation of the patch here is to remove some logging redundancies

For example, all the collection command APIs will print this at the end:

date time INFO (qtp1911006827-256685) [ ] o.a.s.s.HttpSolrCall [admin] webapp=null path=/admin/collections params={action=CREATE&params} status=0 QTime=2

So I don't see a point in Solr printing an INFO message saying "invoking CREATE" as well. So all messages like those were changed to DEBUG

When create collection calls the underlying core admin calls we'll get two more messages

One through 
date time INFO (qtp1911006827-273564) [ ] o.a.s.s.HttpSolrCall [admin] webapp=null path=/admin/cores params={action=CREATE&params} status=0 QTime=0

And a message like "core create command..." for CoreAdminOperation

So the "core create command" type messages have been changed to DEBUG
comments.author: Varun Thacker

comments.content:
Just my two cents... The good thing about the Invoked Collection Action :create and the path=/admin/collections is that they clearly show the beginning and the end of the operation. I find that very useful when debugging. The

INFO  - 2017-11-27 21:55:09.928; [   ] org.apache.solr.cloud.overseer.SliceMutator; createReplica() {
  "operation":"ADDREPLICA",
  "collection":"test",
  "shard":"shard1",
  "core":"test_shard1_replica_n1",
  "state":"down",
  "base_url":"http://172.16.0.83:8983/solr",
  "type":"NRT"} 


(and similar) Is also some of the most useful messages when looking at things that went wrong (replicas/shards going down, recovering, etc). Maybe in the context of create collection they are less useful, but keep in mind that if changed to DEBUG, they also won't log when errors happen.
comments.author: Tomás Fernández Löbbe
